trigger_event: A dormant restoration protocol is discovered, allowing either full recovery of erased citizen data (and exposing hidden abuses) or a permanent shutdown of all BCI scoring.
dilemma: Sven Halek must decide whether to activate the hidden protocol that would instantly restore erased identities and reveal the full extent of BCI’s abuses or allow the BCI to go permanently silent, erasing its authority and history. Both actions will irreversibly redefine the city’s future.
reason: Sven is haunted by the weight of the decision—restoration could spark chaos but offer truth and healing; silence might bring peace and reset, but risk losing accountability forever. As Strategic Messaging Advisor, he knows his judgment will set the tone and future of governance, while conversations with Alex, the bartender, have stirred deeper doubts about trust and control.
choice_a: Activate the restoration protocol, instantly retrieving erased data and exposing long-buried abuses. The city faces a wave of reckoning and a push for open, honest governance.
belief_a: Truth must be faced, no matter how difficult.
Public accountability is the path to meaningful reform.
Restoring lost identities is a moral obligation.
choice_b: Authorize full shutdown of BCI scoring, letting the system vanish quietly and forcing Stenograd to rebuild without algorithmic control.
belief_b: Sometimes forgetting is the only way forward.
True freedom lies beyond surveillance and old scores.
A fresh start is worth the uncertainty.
